paper_metadata.title: A randomized controlled trial of comprehensive case management for poverty reduction

component_a_cash_support.cash_evidence_citation: Treatment participants were assigned a navigator/mentor who worked intensively with clients over two years to identify their short-and long-term goals, create step-by-step plans for progress, and provide cash incentives for completing planned steps.

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: The program recruited very low-income residents and collected detailed baseline information in seven domains: housing, family relationships, health, networks, finances, education, and employment.
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: we report the results of a randomized controlled trial (RCT) evaluation of a CCM anti-poverty program

bonus_information.cost_mentions: Program cost effectiveness discussed in relation to earnings gains
bonus_information.cost_evidence_citation: the program we study is somewhat less expensive so that the present discounted value of earnings gains to participants would exceed the cost of the program if they persist for about seven years

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: we report the results of a randomized controlled trial (RCT) evaluation of a CCM anti-poverty program, "Bridges to Success" (BtS), inspired by Mobility Mentoring and implemented in Rochester, New York
evidence_citations.country_citation: we report the results of a randomized controlled trial (RCT) evaluation of a CCM anti-poverty program, "Bridges to Success" (BtS), inspired by Mobility Mentoring and implemented in Rochester, New York
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: The program recruited very low-income residents | Study participants were very poor, facing both long-term economic barriers and particular crises around the time of enrollment
